lines.text:
[to the bad guys about Buck]
Say he wasn't doin' much singin'. Who was that lily?
There I was sittin' in my hotel in Texas, just about to get hitched to the prettiest widow you ever set your eyes on when I got that fool message of yours to meet you're here in Mesa City.

[watching Buck read a telegram]
Bad news? Anybody dead?

[laconically]
Not yet.

[approaching him the local saloon]
Howdy, Doc.
Howdy.
Long time, no see.
That's right.
Last time we were together we were holdin' hands, remember?
Yeah! Yeah, I remember. You were handcuffed to me.
The law hasn't been so lucky around here lately.
It looks kinda peaceful to me.
Well, we serve sassparilla for those who like it peaceful.
Whatta yuh say we have one?
Why not?
[They approach the bartender]

[referring to McCall]
Say, how did he get them four aces?
I don't know. It was a marked deck.
Better keep an eye on that hombre.
I don't pay off when a man deals a crooked deck.
It happened to be YOUR deck.

[as the townsmen are tearung boards from the sheriff's office door]
Don't look like it's been used recently.
Not since the sheriff was shot two years ago, but it'll hold you.

[closing intertitle]
Watch for THE ROUGH RIDERS when they ride again.
